definition: hair/feather/down/wool/mildew/mold/coarse or semifinished/young/raw/careless/unthinking/nervous/scared/(of currency) to devalue or depreciate/classifier for Chinese fractional monetary unit ( = 角[jiao3] , = one-tenth of a yuan or 10 fen 分[fen1])
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)

sentences.english: White pearl cotton should be stitched only along the top edge.
sentences.chinese: 毛線只用於在襪邊鎖邊。

sentences.english: Will you wind this wool for me?
sentences.chinese: 請你幫我將這些毛線纏起來好嗎？

sentences.english: She crushed the bootee back into the basket and squeezed past the guardhouse.
sentences.chinese: 她把幼兒小毛線鞋放進籃子裏面，擠過警衛室。

sentences.english: You can't work a fine pattern with a thick needle and wool.
sentences.chinese: 你不能用粗針和毛線繡那樣細的圖案。

sentences.english: The girl wound the wool into a ball this morning.
sentences.chinese: 今天早晨女孩把毛線捲成球狀了。

sentences.english: Wear a wool or breathable hat that can be pulled over your ears.
sentences.chinese: 戴一個毛線帽子可以保護耳朵。

sentences.english: Yes, I want a sweater for my daughter, please.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我想買一件毛線衣給我女兒。

sentences.english: You should roll the wool into a ball before you start knitting.
sentences.chinese: 你應當在織毛活兒以前先把毛線繞成線球。

sentences.english: Why do we wear sweaters in cold weather?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼我們會於冷天時穿著毛線衫？

sentences.english: Would you help me to wind this wool into a ball?
sentences.chinese: 請你幫我把這些毛線纏成球好嗎？

sentences.english: The mother rises and picks up her knitting.
sentences.chinese: 母親站起身，拎起她的毛線活兒來。

sentences.english: The cat pawed at the ball of knitting wool again and again.
sentences.chinese: 貓一次又一次地抓這團毛線。
她正在紡織嬰兒毛線鞋。

sentences.english: The colors of her pink sweater and orange blouse screamed at each other.
sentences.chinese: 她的粉紅色毛線衫和橘黃色上衣看上去非常刺目。

definition: Nyima county, Tibetan: Nyi ma rdzong in Nagchu prefecture 那曲地區|那曲地区[Na4 qu3 di4 qu1], central Tibet
what are you doing?/whatever for?/why on earth?
mythical horse/Internet slang for 什麼|什么[shen2 me5]
see 他媽的|他妈的[ta1 ma1 de5]
what are you doing?/what's he up to?
It is said that ... (at the start of a narrative)/to discuss/to recount
to play/to have fun/to hang out
